name: mythic

procedures: T1008::[Mythic] can use a list of C2 URLs as fallback mechanisms in case one IP or domain gets blocked.
T1030::[Mythic] supports custom chunk sizes used to upload/download files.
T1071.002::[Mythic] supports SMB-based peer-to-peer C2 profiles.
T1090.001::[Mythic] can leverage a peer-to-peer C2 profile between agents.
T1090.002::[Mythic] can leverage a modified SOCKS5 proxy to tunnel egress C2 traffic.
T1090.004::[Mythic] supports domain fronting via custom request headers.
T1095::[Mythic] supports WebSocket and TCP-based C2 profiles.
T1119::[Mythic] supports scripting of file downloads from agents.
T1132::[Mythic] provides various transform functions to encode and/or randomize C2 data.
T1572::[Mythic] can use SOCKS proxies to tunnel traffic through another protocol.

description: [Mythic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0699) is an open source, cross-platform post-exploitation/command and control platform. [Mythic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0699) is designed to "plug-n-play" with various agents and communication channels.(Citation: Mythic Github)(Citation: Mythic SpecterOps)(Citation: Mythc Documentation) Deployed [Mythic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0699) C2 servers have been observed as part of potentially malicious infrastructure.(Citation: RecordedFuture 2021 Ad Infra)
